question: At 1030 hours Wednesday, a group of government officials began a tour of the Livermore Defense Lab. The President's daughter, Utopia, was among them. An hour later, she boarded Air Force 3 to Washington.
answer: To the American people - it is time to rise up and demand the surrender of the President and his corrupt theocracy of lies and terror.

question: At 1140 hours, she hijacked the plane. We scanned the videotape on VR. Check it out.
answer: Today is Day One of a brand new world. The days of the empire are finished. To the President - my father, you know what this is. You know what it will do. Unless you abdicate your throne by tomorrow night, I will use it - on you. It will be in my hands - and the hands of my lover. Yes, my lover. My man. The only real man I've ever known. I'm on my way to his arms.

question: Sad story. You got a cigarette?
answer: Shut up, Plissken.

question: What's the little black box do?
answer: Top secret. Only on a need to know.

question: And I don't need to know. So fuck you, I'm goin' to Hollywood.
answer: That's right, big shot. Unless you do what we want you're not coming back.

question: So what's the deal, huh? Go into L.A., find the President's daughter, secure the box, and bring 'em both out - and I'm free?
answer: That's the deal.

question: Tell the President to adopt. I think I'll like L.A. Who are you?
answer: It's the President, for Christ's sake!

question: I give you my word. Put the prototype into my hands, and you're a free man.
answer: I can see you're real concerned about your daughter.

question: Utopia is lost to me. My daughter is gone.
answer: Well, I'll think it over.

question: You're running out of time.
answer: I've been doin' that all my life. Might as well do it in L.A. Everybody else there is.

question: I've been doin' that all my life. Might as well do it in L.A. Everybody else there is.
answer: Well, enjoy it, war hero, cause you got 10 hours to live.

question: Wait a minute, what are you talkin' about?
answer: Having second thoughts?

question: Maybe. But you're not putting any shit in me this time.
answer: You don't understand. It's already in you. The cigarette girl in New Vegas was an undercover cop. She injected you with incentive toxin. Right now it's swimming in your bloodstream. It'll start to take effect in 9 hours.

question: Very sweet little weapon. Core burner. Magnesium ammo. 500 extra rounds. Two 9mm handguns. Oral projectile. Mouth dart. Hold it in your mouth for ten seconds, the coating dissolves, it becomes a weapon. Urolite. It'll stun the enemy for several seconds.
answer: Tracer. Utopia has a kidnap chip implanted in her arm. You can locate her with this.

question: This clips right onto your 9mm. Ammo enhancers. Like miniaturized grenades. Blows through anything.
answer: L.A. is in a constant state of warfare. Gangs fighting for the right to rule.

question: Heavy Third World connections. They get weapons, drugs, fuel, choppers - everything is pumped into the island from the south.
answer: Some areas have power - they're on line to San Onofre.

question: Some areas have power - they're on line to San Onofre.
answer: I'll need to know more about this thing.

question: Only a handful of people are aware of its existence. Let's just say it's the ultimate defensive weapon.
answer: Defense against what?

question: There's a war about to be declared, or didn't you know? Third World wants to live like we do - and they plan on taking what they want. The Cubans and Brazilians are ready to invade Miami. If the Africans and Colombians make a run at the border, we got a full scale attack on the United States.
answer: So what does this thing do?

question: All you need to know is get it back here by 5 a.m. You're going over by submarine. One-man submersible. Nuclear powered.
answer: Where do I put ashore?

question: Cahuenga Pass. Make your way up through the mountains toward the Hollywood Bowl. You should be able to pick up Utopia's tracer there. Once you go inside, you're on your own. You know what you have to do with the girl, don't you? We have to spare this nation her trial - for treason.
answer: So you want me to take her out? Is that an order from the President?

question: Let's just say it's what's best for the country.
answer: By the way - who gives me the anti-toxin?

question: A medical team will be standing by.
answer: Not you?

question: No.
answer: Good.

question: Thought you might try that. First clip is filled with blanks. Goodbye, Plissken.
answer: Com check.

question: I'm here, Plissken. Stand by for launch. Ignitor. Fuel rod injection.
answer: She's in the green.

question: Lock fuel rods.
answer: Locked.

question: Nuclear turbine to 75% power.
answer: 75% power.

question: Plissken, slow down the sub. You're overloading the power plant.
answer: Plissken glances at the gauge. His nuclear turbine readout

question: Plissken...?
answer: Plissken hangs on, as small jets of water spray into the cockpit through tiny cracks in the hull. Plissken presses the hatch controls. The sub begins to slide backwards down toward the water. Plissken struggles, then rips open the hatch, scrambles out. The sub slowly slips backwards, down into the water. As the rear exhaust tubes hit the surface, a blast of steam. Plissken leaps out of the hatch. The sub sinks faster and faster. He scampers up the side, leaps for ground... and lands on the hillside, as the sub sinks into the sea, bubbling, churning, hissing.

question: What's going on? What's happening? As the other Mescalito riding behind him swings a chain. Plissken swings his. The two chains snap together, intertwining. Then Plissken squeezes his hand-brake. He screeches to a stop. The Mescalito keeps going, and is yanked over backward by his own chain, off the Harley. Finally the Harley flops over, skids, explodes. Plissken guns it again, takes off after the Cadillac.
answer: Snake Plissken.

question: As the bolas hit him, wrap around his neck, the balls thunking him in the face, sending him flying...
answer: Later, Snake. We finish it later.

question: Lies there for several beats, then climbs to his feet. Stands alone in the deserted street. The ruins of a supermarket, cheap motels, liquor stores - all empty, desolate.
answer: Sits in an old beach chair on the sidewalk, a map to the stars sign in front of him. In his late 50's, he's a petty thief, con man. He's been hustling tourists and everybody else all his life. Wow! Snake Plissken! You're a star in your own right, you know that? Hey, I'm Map To The Stars Eddie. How you doin'?

question: Where'd they go?
answer: Man, I'd love to have your autograph, Snake. I've been hearing about you ever since that New York deal back in the 90's. You're one smooth operator. Could you sign one to Wolf, one to Death's Head, one to Slasher Smith...?

question: Where are they?
answer: Who? You mean Cuervo Jones? He's the man with the juice, Snake. Got the President's daughter. Setting up a citywide truce. Big doings.

question: Location.
answer: Cuervo's got a place near Venice, where the big birds fly. Nice digs, too. I've been there, y'know. Nice little gizmo you got there. Look, Snake. I've got connections in this town. You need something, I'm your man. Hey - you can't go there, Snake. You can't walk through Beverly Hills.

question: Hi, Snake. It's so great to meet you. My name's Taslima. I'm a fan of yours.
answer: Are you crazy?

question: A little bit. But pretty soon I'm gonna be dead. So are you, Snake. I can't believe I got caught. I run with Midnight Jihad. Iranian gang. Only they kicked me out, cause I screw up sometimes. I forget stuff. I left my boyfriend's place tonight, took a wrong turn... Oh, Snake, I'm really kind of out of it sometimes.
answer: What are they?

question: They live here, used to be like us. But after too many silicon implants, their muscles turned to jelly. The only way they survive is to have body parts transplanted over and over again. Snake, nobody who comes into Beverly Hills gets out alive.
answer: No screamin' shit.

question: Oh no, it's the Doctor.
answer: Who?

question: The Surgeon General of Beverly Hills.
answer: Turns his head sideways, to a small hidden pocket near his neck. With his teeth, he pulls out the silver mouth dart, slips it onto his tongue, closes his mouth.

question: Snake, help me. I don't know.
answer: Don't follow me.

question: You need help.
answer: Like hell I do.

question: Down this way.
answer: This is a dead end. You took us into a dead end!

question: I just thought you wanted to get away. I didn't know you wanted to go someplace.
answer: Go!

question: Be careful of the bald cats. They live in these buildings.
answer: The what? Are you gonna stand there? Give me the gun! How do we get out of here?

question: Sewers. Come on. Down there. Snake - what is it?
answer: How the hell am I supposed to know? This is your damn city.

question: How the hell am I supposed to know? This is your damn city.
answer: What're you doing in here?

question: Looking to get out.
answer: Good. I want you out. This is my sewer.

question: Which way?
answer: You're Snake Plissken.

question: You're Snake Plissken.
answer: Yes. Isn't he cool?

question: An honor, Snake. Amigo. They call me Pendejo Bob. Those damn patients are coming back. You'd better climb aboard. I use the eye and the music to scare em off. They're so whacked out, man, it works great. Chased a whole bunch of em right off the edge there a few months ago.
answer: How far down does it go?

question: Don't know - never do hear em land. Earthquake opened it up. I own this whole place. Used to work here in the old days. I was right in this room when the big one hit. What a mess. We were waist high in shit. Everybody else ran, but not me. I stayed at my post. Now it's all mine. I brought my whole family, my amigos, down here to live with me.
answer: Gun runners.

question: The freeway's over there. But, Snake - I don't think it's such a good idea. The freeways are dangerous. Goodbye, Snake. Sun's coming up in a few hours. UV's gonna be bad today. I have a friend who's got a place near here. We can crash there if you want, Snake. I'd love to take care of you. Make you feel good. I changed my mind. I'm going with you, wherever you're going.
answer: What the hell is this?

question: The freeway.
answer: I know that. There are people in some of these cars.

question: It's where they live. I guess after everything happened, they just needed to do what they'd always done before. During the daytime, they just pull down the shades on their windows and sleep. What are you gonna do in Venice?
answer: Find Cuervo Jones.

question: No! Stay away, Snake. He's mucho muerte. Run, Snake...They're coming.
answer: Who?

question: I don't know.
answer: Returns fire, rolls under a car and begins crawling. All around him people jump out of their cars, begin firing back at the Mescalitos. Reaches the edge of the freeway, dives for the bushes.

question: Returns fire, rolls under a car and begins crawling. All around him people jump out of their cars, begin firing back at the Mescalitos. Reaches the edge of the freeway, dives for the bushes.
answer: Hop in, Snake! Hey, Snake - that was great. They almost burned your ass off! Too many people know where you're going, Snake. That's not good. Delgado and his men were back there waiting for you.

question: Delgado?
answer: Cuervo Jones' right-hand man. One tough hombre. You don't understand, Snake. Cuervo Jones wants to unify the island. We're on the move, man. Big time.

question: Stop the damn car.
answer: No way.

question: I said pull over.
answer: All right. Anything for you, Snake. Although I was going to take you to Cuervo Jones' place.

question: Where is it?
answer: Right over there.

question: Grits his teeth and gasps. His gun drops. Blood runs from four holes in his shirt. His face grows red as he fights for air.
answer: Pretty neat, huh? This is Cuervo's car. He lets me use it sometimes. Not to worry, Snake. You were just shot with a fun-gun. You feel it? Pure mesh, man. 100-proof artery choker. Like Cuervo says, when the hit pulls you down to one inch from death, that is living, man. You should've talked to me first, Snake. I could've set this whole thing up. I'm actually Cuervo's agent, you know. And I'd love to represent you, too. We could make a bundle together. I know I could really help your career...I mean, you're a legend and all - but the last couple years, man, it's like you've fallen off the face of the earth. Come on, Cuervo. I delivered him, didn't I? All I'm asking for is what you promised.

question: We'll see. Carrot juice? Laced with tequila, Snake. Good for you. No? Your health. You're coming out of it, Snake. It hurts real bad. That's good. Dying isn't good enough for you. You need pain. You'll never make it to where you want to go without a little pain. Snake Plissken. American outlaw. So typical of American idealism. The old west, Snake. Man against the sky. The individual. Freedom. No wonder they hate you so much in America, Snake. You remind them of what they used to be. Here is the real L.A., Snake. The poor. The old. The lost. People without hope. Do you know what they want? One word. Liberation. They want a chance to live - before it's all gone. They've been hated for too long
answer: Cuervo! LaToya Jackson just won Best Actress. You said I could hold it. Who's that?

question: You never heard of Snake Plissken?
answer: He doesn't look like his picture. I bet he's fake.

question: Now go get dressed. We have things to do.
answer: Are we going to eat soon? I'm starved. Ooww!

question: My... father sent you... didn't he? He sent you to kill me... Didn't he?
answer: Shit. Get out of here. I said go!

question: Don't take it back. Don't give it to him. Please. Let me have it.
answer: What does this thing do?

question: So long, Snake.
answer: Where is he?

question: He jumped. Down there. He's dead, Cuervo. I did it. I killed Plissken.
answer: Give it to me.

question: You said I could be Vice-President, Cuervo. Your right-hand man.
answer: Give it.

question: Sure, Cuervo, but look here. I've done it all, man. I killed Plissken, I got your girl back, I got it all. Just for you, Cuervo. Just for you.
answer: This is turning out to be my lucky day. Get this asshole outta here.

question: Cuervo...?
answer: You're my woman, you understand? You don't let anybody take you away from me without a fight.

question: I tried...
answer: Nobody leaves Cuervo Jones. Not unless you give your life. You fight till you're dead. Then I forgive you. Understand? Understand?

question: Yes...
answer: Let's go. Look, baby. They're all mine.

question: Emerges from the hole, slides out, tumbles down to a water-filled canyon bottom. He lies there for a moment, trying to focus his eye. Stabbing pain in his shoulder and leg. Finally he rises unsteadily to his feet, looks around, trying to get his bearings. He finds himself at the bottom of...
answer: Snake. Saw you at the game tonight. Great shot. You look like shit. You feel those pre-shocks, Snake? Could be a big one comin' any minute now...

question: Where's... Cuervo Jones...?
answer: Long gone. You'll never catch up with him now, Snake.

question: Where?
answer: Anaheim. Headquarters for everything. The whole town's gonna be there. Things changin' fast around here, Snake. It's not the same as the old days, man.

question: Take me there...
answer: You ain't doin' so good, Snake. You need help. You should talk to Hershe. She hates Cuervo. They used to be partners, but they split up.

question: Who?
answer: Hershe. She lives downtown with Mojo Dellasandro in the big boat. Down that way. She's connected with the Black Cowboys, and they don't take shit from nobody... Yo', man. It's a big one. Tsunami, Snake. Surf's up big time. Get ready, Snake. It's gonna be some kinda ride. Let the front edge pick you up. Don't get on your board till it peaks. Don't lose it, man. You slip off your board and it's the Big Wipeout, you know what I mean? Hang on, Snake! YAAAAAAA!!!! Awesome, Snake. AWESOME, man!

question: See you later. Listen up. I need directions. Downtown. Somebody named Hershe.
answer: Sure, Snake. No problem. You gonna kill me?

question: Later.
answer: I couldn't help it, Snake. I had to shoot you. Cuervo made me do it, I swear to God, man.

question: Cease fire with the bullshit.
answer: Right. Keep goin' straight. Two blocks down, turn right.

question: Yeah. With me and Texas Mike O'Shay.
answer: I was called away on urgent business, Snake.

question: Don't lie to me.
answer: All right, so I made another deal.

question: We have a little arrangement. Anything happens to me, you're dead.
answer: I'm already dead.

question: I see your point. What's the favor?
answer: Get me to Cuervo Jones. Get me to the Kingdom. I got one hour.

question: Dream on, blue eye.
answer: Say goodnight, Carjack.

question: And he's got the prototype. And the girl. He holds all the cards.
answer: Exactly what is this prototype? What does it do?

question: You push the button, it sends a signal to a ring of space defense satellites. They're orbiting bombs. Nukes. They explode. Huge space burst. EMP. Electromagnetic Pulse. It happens instantly when a nuke is airburst. EMP shuts down every power source below the satellites - instantly. All electrical devices, computers, cars, airplanes, cities. It's the dark ages again.
answer: So whoever has it runs the show.

question: Bluebacks. I'm not bullshittin'. I swear to God.
answer: I don't know, sounds thin to me.

question: You want to stay here, while Cuervo Jones rules the world?
answer: No, that sucks. How are we getting out?

question: Cuervo. Hey, man, I made it! I made it! Wait for me... Hey Cuervo...
answer: Would you please kill him for me?

question: Cuervo, wait! I got news. There's about to be an attack. You're about to get hit, Cuervo. It's Plissken.
answer: You told me he was dead.

question: I thought he was, but he came back.
answer: Where?

question: Oh Cuervo...
answer: What?

question: It's so good to see you again.
answer: Where's Plissken?

question: He's... near.
answer: You're stalling, Eddie. Talk, you little gringo!

question: Cuervo, look out behind you!
answer: You've lied to me for the very last time.
